release.action: Update checkstyle rules and eclipse settings: - Define new file header without SVN keywords and a compact copyright notice instead.
Update checkstyle rules: - Do not check JUnit outside unit tests - Do not check for AbstractClassName in unit tests - Exclude checkstyle checks for generated sources in target folder.

Update checkstyle rules and eclipse settings: - Most important change: "m" and "p" prefixes are no longer required for member variabled and method parameters. - HiddenField: ignoreAbstractMethods=true, ignoreConstructorParameter=true, ignoreSetter=true - New checks: ParameterAssignment, AbstractClassName, ExplicitInitialization, JUnitTestCase, MissingDeprecated, MissingOverride, MissingSwitchDefault, MultipleVariableDeclarations, OuterTypeFilename, OuterTypeNumber, TypecastParenPad - Use suppression filter to suppress some rules in unit tests - Check JavaDocs via Checkstyle, not Eclipse, and use relaxed rules for checking. Eclipse is only used for checking malformed JavaDoc tags
Findbugs: - Disable UR_UNINIT_READ, BC_IMPOSSIBLE_INSTANCEOF and BC_VACUOUS_INSTANCEOF check
PMD/Checkstyle: Sync rules with DBS rules (slight adjustements)
PMD: - Update to PMD 5.x syntax - Exlude some rules new to PMD 5.x
Eclipse: - Do not automatically reformat block and line comments, only javadoc comments. - Use maximum of 120 characters for formatting javadoc comments.
PMD: - Deactivate some rules that make no sense. - Deactivate all "code size" rules: complexity metrics should be analyzed via code review or sonar inspection, and not enforced by ide rules

Checkstyle: - Disable junit testcase check because it can produce false positives. - Disable all javadoc checks because they are not precise, we will re-enable the eclipse javadoc checks again instead - Enable checking unit test files as well (there is no reason why unit tests should be written without style compliance) - Disable checks for unused imports (are resolved by eclipse automatically, and report false positives if used in {@link} statments in javadocs. - Disable check for operator wrapping - it is legal to put operators on beginning or end of line - Apply WhitespaceAround check without constraints to align with eclipse formatter settings
PMD: - Disable cyclomatic complexity check - Disable coupling and excessive imports check

Eclipse: - Re-enable javadoc checks for public types/methods because we disable it in checkstyle - Enable auto-format of edited code lines on save - Set default resource encoding to UTF-8 and line endings to window-style
